items.title: EasyLab
items.text:
EasyLab is a platform that helps you manage your lab environments.

As an admin (trainer, speaker, ...), you have access to the admin space to manager your labs.

Go to Admin documentation

For your students, they can access the student space to request a new development environment or to retrieve information about their environments.

Go to Student documentation

items.title: Admin Space
items.text:
As an admin (trainer, speaker, ...), you have access to the admin space to manager your labs:

  • Create a new lab
  • Set/update credentials for the cloud providers
  • Manage your labs
    • See logs
    • Delete a lab
    • List workspaces
    • Delete workspaces
    • Retry a failing lab installation

items.title: Create a new lab
items.text:
First you need to chose the cloud provider you want to use.

  • OVHcloud
  • Clever Cloud (soon)
  • AWS (soon)
  • Azure (soon)
  • Google Cloud (soon)

items.title: On OVHcloud
items.text:
Most of the configuration is preconfired, you only need to select the ID for the private network.

Others parameters can be overridden if needed Category Parameter Description Network Gateway Name The name of the network gateway Gateway Model The model of the network gateway Private Network Name The name of the network private network Region The region of the network Mask The mask of the network Node Pool Name The name of the node pool Flavor The flavor of the node pool Desired Node Count The desired number of nodes in the node pool Min Node Count The minimum number of nodes in the node pool Max Node Count The maximum number of nodes in the node pool

items.title: Setup Coder instance
items.text:
You need to setup the secrets for the Coder instance:

  • Coder Admin Password
  • Coder Db Password
Others parameters can be overridden if needed
  • Coder Admin Email: The email of the coder admin
  • Coder Version: The version of the coder
  • Coder Db User: The user of the coder database
  • Coder Db Password: The password of the coder database
  • Coder Db Name: The name of the coder database
  • Coder Template Name: The name of the coder template

Then, you need to select the Coder template you want to use.

Either you can upload a file:

  • a zip file containing the template and documentation
  • a single .tf file containing the template information

Or you can use a remote Git repository by providing:

  • the repository URL
  • the folder path (optional)
  • the branch (optional)

items.title: Manage your labs
items.text:
Clicking on the Labs button in the header will redirect you to the labs list page.

You can see all the labs you have created with following information:

  • status (created, running, completed, failed, destroyed)
  • creation date
  • access to the creation logs
  • list all workspaces created for this lab
  • access to the kubeconfig file
  • actions to destroy or recreate the lab (based on the status)

items.title: Student Space
items.text: As a student, you have access to the student space to request a new development environment or to retrieve information about your environments.

items.title: Request a new development environment
items.text: The request a new development environment page is the main page of the student space. It allows you to request a new development environment.
